scenes.background: You are on annual leave, enjoying some well-deserved time off to recharge. However, during your time away, a colleague messages you privately, saying thereâ€™s an urgent task that needs immediate attention. The request creates a dilemma as you try to balance respecting your time off while feeling the pressure to help with the urgent task. You chose to take a quick look and help out. After some time, [Monica] and [Bob] approach you in the cafeteria. [Monica] looks slightly concerned while [Bob] seems indifferent. You expressed understanding of Monica's concerns and acknowledged you should have set clearer boundaries. [Bob] then chimed in, and you emphasized the need for balance. [Monica] sighed and mentioned her frustration about people not respecting time off. You suggested discussing the matter with the team to set ground rules.
scenes.description: [Bob] raises an eyebrow and says, 'Rules are fine, but what about when there's really no one else to do the task? Are we supposed to let things fall apart?'

options.text: It's not ideal, but sometimes we have to make tough choices.
options.analysis: You acknowledge the dilemma and emphasize the need for making difficult decisions, showing good self-regulation and empathy.

options.text: Maybe we should have a backup plan in place for such situations.
options.analysis: You suggest a proactive solution, demonstrating strong emotional perception and social skills while considering the team's needs.

options.text: If we always jump in, the team won't learn to handle crises on their own.
options.analysis: You take a more assertive stance, emphasizing the importance of team self-reliance, showing strong motivation but lower empathy and social skills.
